articles.author: Will Murray
articles.title: Tim Paine's brother hits out over Cricket Australia's handling of texting affair
articles.description: The brother of former Australian cricket captain Tim Paine lashes cricket officials over their handling of the Tasmanian's treatment following the texting affair, saying he deserved a home town Ashes send-off against England in Hobart.
articles.content:
Tim Paine's brother, Nick, has described watching the fifth Ashes test wrap up without the former national cricket captain and Hobart-local on the field as "gut-wrenching".
Key points:

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.title: 'This has to be our rock bottom' - despair at England's capitulation
articles.description: Former England cricketers and pundits reacts to the tourists' latest Ashes collapse as the England lose in Hobart and Australia complete a 4-0 series win.
articles.content:
"That has to be our rock bottom."
Those were the words of former England captain Sir Alastair Cook after the tourists' Ashes misery finally came to an end in a familiar fashion.

articles.title: What we learned from watching the 1992 World Cup final in full again | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.description: Wides, lbw calls, swing - plenty of things were different in white-ball cricket back then | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.content: Last week, we at ESPNcricinfo did something we have been thinking of doing for eight years now: pretend-live ball-by-ball commentary for a classic cricket match. We knew the result, yes, but we tried… [+6823 chars]
